column1: A Nasdaq 100 special rebalance will take place July 24. Apple, Microsoft and the other "magnificent seven" stocks hold a 55% weight now.

Tesla stock received another price-target increase Monday, following a slew of similar actions by firms last week after the EV giant reported record global deliveries. Jefferies analyst Philippe Houchois hiked the firm's TSLA price target to 265, up from 185, Monday. Last week, numerous firms, including Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan, increased their price targets after Tesla deliveries jumped to 466,140 in the second quarter, sprinting past Q1's record 422,875 and Q4's 405,278.
Rivian stock is up for a ninth consecutive trading session. The rally in the EV shares feels like short covering.
Nasdaq says it plans to rebalance the Nasdaq 100 stock index to adjust for the huge surge this year in megacap tech stock prices.

5Rivian Automotive's shares ([RIVN](https://www.wsj.com/market-data/quotes/RIVN)) rose over 5% in morning trading, pointing to another bumper day for the electric-vehicle maker's stock. It has risen for the past eight trading sessions, gaining nearly 84% in that period and closing at the highest level since December on Friday.

Everyone wants a market slice. Retail traders increased their net exposure to equities in June as U.S. stocks climbed, according to broker [TD Ameritrade](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20230710538096/en/TD-Ameritrade-Investor-Movement-Index-June-IMX-Score-Rises-Despite-Selling-During-Market-Rally) on Monday.
We also chat with Dave Meyer of the "Bigger Pockets" podcast about demographic shifts impacting real estate investing.

Shares of General Motors (NYSE: GM) were moving higher last month as the automaker gained following bullish comments at an industry conference and as investors cheered its decision to adopt Tesla's electric vehicle (EV) charging standard, known as the North American Charging Standard (NACS), starting with its 2025 EVs. Additionally, GM seemed to benefit from an improving macroeconomic picture and a generally rising tide in electric vehicle stocks as other EV companies moved to adopt NACS, eliminating a potential pain point in EV adoption. According to data from S&P Global Market Intelligence, the stock finished the month up 19%.
